00019 #include "fsal_internal.h"
00020 #include "fsal_convert.h"

00022 
00057 fsal_status_t FSAL_access(
00058     fsal_handle_t              * object_handle,      /* IN */
00059     fsal_op_context_t          * p_context,          /* IN */
00060     fsal_accessflags_t         access_type,          /* IN */
00061     fsal_attrib_list_t         * object_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00062 ){
00063 
00064   int hpss_test_mode = 0;
00065   int rc;
00066   fsal_status_t st;
00067           
00068   /* sanity checks.
00069    * note : object_attributes is optionnal in FSAL_getattrs.
00070    */
00071   if (!object_handle || !p_context)
00072     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_access);
00073   
00074   /* converts fsal access type to hpss access type */
00075   
00076   hpss_test_mode = fsal2hpss_testperm(access_type);
00077   
00078   
00079   /* call to HPSS access */
00080   
00081   TakeTokenFSCall();
00082   
00083   rc = hpss_AccessHandle(
00084                   &(object_handle->ns_handle), /* IN - parent object handle */
00085                   NULL,                /* IN - path of file to check access rights */
00086                   hpss_test_mode,      /* IN - Type of access to be checked */
00087                   &p_context->credential.hpss_usercred, /* IN - user credentials */
00088                   NULL                 /* OUT - authorization ticket */ );
00089   
00090   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00091   
00092   /* convert returned code */  
00093   /* The HPSS_ENOENT error actually means that handle is STALE */
00094   if ( rc == HPSS_ENOENT )
00095     Return( ERR_FSAL_STALE, -rc, INDEX_FSAL_access);
00096   else if (rc)
00097     Return( hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_access);
00098   
00099   
00100   /* get attributes if object_attributes is not null.
00101    * If an error occures during getattr operation,
00102    * it is returned, even though the access operation succeeded.
00103    */
00104   if ( object_attributes ){
00105     fsal_status_t status;
00106     
00107     status = FSAL_getattrs( object_handle, p_context , object_attributes );
00108     
00109     /* on error, we set a special bit in the mask. */        
00110     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00111     {
00112       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00113       FSAL_SET_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00114           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00115     }
00116     
00117   }
00118   
00119   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_access );
00120   
00121 }
